Articles.Content:
Love this game...but launching a 200 ton rocket just sounds so meh. I'd expect the bass to rumble so much stuff in my neighbors house is falling of the shelf, but no.

TL:DR If you can't be arsed to read one sentence than Kerbal is not for you. MOAR BASS

Like just about every other aspect of this still-developing game, the current sound system is a placeholder which will be replaced or reworked later. In the meantime, since this is a suggestion-sort of a post, it will be moved to the development suggestions sub-forum.
I personally turn the sound way down. I don't want my neighbors calling the cops every time I lift off.

Yeah, I bought a big-ass bass for my desktop, and I want to use it! What I most love about rocket launches is the ground-breaking crackle you hear a couple of seconds before engine ignition.

Remember the shuttle launches? Those SRBs ROARED through the sky!
I don't get it, when I launch, or crash, the explosions certainly hit pretty hard. :v
what i would like to see is some more/better sound content. i mostly play on mute because its mind numbingly bland.

I don't get it, when I launch, or crash, the explosions certainly hit pretty hard. :v

They're loud enough for sure, what I want is the below hearable(not a word) bass of -20hz.

Most speakers these days won't do subsonic sounds anyway, unless you have one hell of a subwoofer or other bass speaker. If you're going to be simulating that kind of noise, I'd start being worried about things getting broken around the computer, if not components being shaken loose in the computer itself.
